person.persName: William Powhattan Bolling Grayson (Henderson County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier.)

body.p: Henderson County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Susan Grayson. Father of Mary E. Grayson, Susan Grayson, Sophia Grayson, Hebe Grayson, and Roger Grayson. Farmer in Henderson County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned fifteen enslaved persons in Henderson County in 1850. Farmer in Henderson County in 1860. Owned twenty-two enslaved persons in 1860. Served in the 13th Kentucky Cavalry (C.S.A.) as a colonel from October 12, 1864 to July 25, 1865. Captured at Hardinsburg, Breckinridge County, Kentucky, on January 24, 1865. Transported from Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, to Camp Chase, Franklin County, Ohio, on April 4, 1865. Signed a loyalty oath to the U.S. government on July 25, 1865. Released from Camp Chase on July 25, 1865.
